40139342.review:
Cat Goes Fishing is a simple but very cute and fun indie fishing simulator.  You play as a furry little cat and infront of you lies a vast sea to scour and fish.  You start on land with only a basic rod.  Then you can sell the fish you catch for money to buy improved fishing gear, boats, and plenty of other items to help you catch some of the bigger, more challenging, and rare fish.  There is a good amount of customization which allows you to develope your own style of fishing.  The game is very casual and the simple controls makes it easy to play.  Still there is plenty of action and strategy involved in wrestling the fish back to the surface without being eaten by bigger fish.  There is a large and unique variety of fish, and a organized log to keep track of the fish you caught.  Each type of fish has its own behavior and specific location that adds to the challenge of catching it.  You can also find plenty of hats to wear in the sea that add a nice bonus and cosmetic to your cat.  Cat Goes Fishing is short, though there is a suprising amount of depth and alot of charm which makes this game highly replayable.  This game is well worth the money and the time spent.

39360912.review:
Like Many have said, this game is relaxing. It's something to do when just sort of sitting around. It's simple enough to be straight forward, sometimes is a little tricky and sometimes a little about luck. Sometimes it can be just a little frustrating in a good way, where it's just enough to keep you wanting to play more, but the game is casual easy, which I think is part of what makes it so relaxing.

Pros:

Graphics are just down right adorable. It might be a little like a flash game, but I find nothing wrong with the simplicity of that because it works for what the game is (not to mention there is just nothing wrong with flash games in general, game is a game).
The fish all have a certain charm to them with the artistic style. The Cat is Cute. The game's graphics and aesthetics all contribute nicely to the games relaxing feeling.

The controls are simple and easy. Casting is easy to control, and boat movement is simple enough. Combining the two adds some extra control for the player. Menu's are straightforward to navigate through.

The strategy for the game is quite simple to figure out, so it's not really challenging persey, but that's just part of the simplistic nature of the game, which I think really just lends to the casual relaxation of it. Cat Goes Fishing doesn't need terribly complex controls and stategy to be fun.

The music track 'Easy Lemon' is so absolutely perfect for this game, and incredibly relaxing. I personally find attatchment to games in part from the audio componants of them, with music being a powerful aspect, and when I play this game I absolutely never get sick of hearing Easy Lemon.... I didn't like the other track much, it was ok. I kept finding myself wanting to hear easy lemon instead though (as silly as that is). I also enjoy the sound effects, the cat's little myau's are perfect little polishes to the game in my opinion.

Another great aspect about this game that I think is overlooked a little, is how nice it is that the dev has taken time to do some bug fixes over the years, and some rebalancing and even some content updates (with another planned content update at the time of this writing from what I understand from their web page).

Constructive Criticisms:

I find it can be a little dodgey to toss fish into the back of a boat, so whenever I catch something that's really worth a lot I just take it straight back to shore. Would be nice if there was maybe just a button that moves a fish into the boat without risk of it falling out the back. Been a few time's that I was disapointed from trying to toss the larger fishies into the boat, only to have them accidently bounce out the back and turn into bait. Course, the work around is bring it to shore ASAP, but that breaks a little immersion.

It would be nice if hats were equipable like the fishing rods. I stick with the Cuddlebane I caught because I really like it's effect, but sometimes I wish I could swap out to a different hat just for aesthetics  or different stats. This is a feature I think should be added, particularly because without a hat storage and equip changing it makes me fear hat's I see in the water... I did a save edit just one time because I was so disapointed when I accidently hooked a common hat I did not want..
I felt a little dirty for doing that, but also justified it because hat swapping makes just as much sense as changing your boat. They shouldnt need to be rebought, especially because some are not purchaseable (like the Cuddlebane). It would add collectability to the hats and make them appealing to catch, rather than something aversive due to fear of losing the ability on a currently worn hat.

There's a lack of small fish at night time, which makes it really hard to begin catching larger fish, such as the Noctis and other plethora of medium sized fish that are available at night. I understand that night seems like the sort of time where small fish would be hiding, and sleeping etc.. But when catching larger fish requires the need for your bait to scale up in steps it can be a little bit of a disapointment when you see all the interesting night fish you'd like to catch up, but just cant because lack of bait. Sure, there is the wait button to go back to daytime, but that doesn't quite solve the issue.
What would solve it though, and would be great even for daytime fishing, is if different sized bait's were just purchasable from the shop. I think that would work great with the current level of Small fish at night, because it would make night time feel a bit more special and something to save money up for during the day, as well as lend itself to the casual nature of the game. Making only level 1 and level 2 bait available in the shop would be a good balance, so that level 3 still requires the recasting of a medium sized fish that's been caught.
Maybe even just make it a "bait tin" item you can click to "bait the hook" and be something you can hold only a limited number of and be purchaseable only during the day. Could be a whole new type of item to upgrade, similar to the boat, where different stages of tin hold different quantities of differing levels of bait. It's all just a thought.

And the Last Constructive Criticism I have is the lack of a full version on iOS and Andriod....
This isn't a real criticism of the game I guess, just a wish really..
I seriously wish very much that there was a full version for iOS and android (especially iOS).
I know there is a LITE version for Andriod (and I have it), but I would certainly have no issue paying for this game again on my Android and iOS devices. I really recommend the dev make a full version available for both... Would be really wonderful to have it for those platforms as the full version.
With support on more platforms it could reach more people, and the casualness of this game would be just SO perfect for mobile devices. I'd personally buy the game for a few people I know if the full version was on Android and iOS (as I know a few people with these platforms that would absolutely love to have this game with them on the go, of course myself included).

Cat goes fishing is a game that I think many people can enjoy.

Hi zusammen,

was soll ich sagen...

Das Spiel ist was es ist. Ein sehr sehr angenehmer Zeitvertreib!
Die Aufmachung ist nett und man merkt wie viel Liebe im Detail steckt. Die Entwickler scheinen wirklich viel Leidenschaft in die die Feinheiten zu stecken.

Eine Katze die angelt? Auf einem Boot? Die einen Hut trägt?
Für die Idee erstmal einen kleinen aber bedeutenden Applaus.

Ich bin begeistert und bin nach dem Kauf nicht enttäuscht worden.
Das Game findet immer wieder Platz zwischen anderen Runden oder einfach entspanntes Daddeln am Abend ohne große Aufregung.

Beste Grüße!

33820621.review: Cat Goes Fishing is a wonderful little game about a cat that goes fishing. Need i say more?

33646511.review: Cat Goes Fishing can be summed up in the title, you play as a cat and you fish. The game however goes farther than the premise. There are two modes to play, classic and realistic. Classic is a mode where you can catch any fish and they will not fight back, in realistic the fish fight your reel and the bigger the fish the bigger the fight. There are over 40 different species of fish to catch in the game which fall into the categories of small, medium, large, and huge. The fish also all have different sale values. There are many different fishing rods and even more rod upgrades to buy as well as boats and bait upgrades. All the upgrades in the game can truly change the mechanics of the gameplay which is fun to evolve into how you want to play. There are also over 20 hats to find and collect in the ocean which give various upgrades and buffs also changing gameplay. The game can be a grind at some points saving up for more expensive items, but the grinds do not last very long. This game is very calming and relaxing as well as intense. It is a load of fun exploring the ocean and fighting to catch a new fish you just saw or completing the quests you have been assigned. Overall Cat Goes Fishing is a very fun addictive game and is a cacophony which is all new and original, and the wealth of things to do will keep you coming back for more. I can beyond a shadow of a doubt recommend this game to anyone and everyone interested. Fish on.

33367334.review: Хорошая игра и точно стоит своих денег в неё можно как задродить как и просто расслабляться. По сюжету прошлых игры от этого автора мы играли за хомяка который ловил рыбу в 1 части мы нашли письмо в бутылке и наш герой ришает наловить очень много рыбы для того чтобы продать её и получить более большую леску для того чтобы поймать поймать Робинзона и доставить к себе на остров. Во 2 части мы играем уже за 2 хомяка (наверное за возлюбленую). По сюжету 2 части нашего рыбака забирает акула и наш 2 хомяк решает поймать акулу для того чтобы освободить другого хомяка. А вот уже во 3 части мы играем за котика рыбака который как и в прошлых играх ловит рыбку только тут сюжета нет. В игре есть несколько типов рыбок: 1.маленькие, 2.средние, 3.большые и 4. Огромные. Для каждого типа свои наживки: для маленьких это синяя, для средних жёлтая получается путём закидыванием маленьких рыбок в воду, 3. Для больших оранжевая (За исключением рыбы меча надо поймать рыбу ежа для её поимки)и для 4 типа там чутле не у каждой свой подход. Также есть шапки которые улучшают нашего котика, также можно покупать новые удочки и улучшать их а также можно купить лодку для поимки новых рыбок. Также в игре есть 2 сложности обычная и реалестичная. На обычной сложности рыба не сопратевляется вообще а вот на реалестичной рыбы ведут себя по разному. Вообщем игра хорошая и своих денжаток стоит. 10  каддл фишей из 10.

31789718.review:
처음 보이는 모습은 얼핏 10분하고 그만 둘 플래시게임처럼 생겼으나
생각보다 훨씬 갓겜입니다 이 리뷰를 쓰는 시점은 대략 플탐 10시간을 찍은 때 입니다

우선 게임의 가장 기본이 되는 물고기잡기 디자인이 재밌게 잘 되어있습니다 금방 질리지 않습니다
초반에는 아무 생각없이 막 잡다보면 될테지만, 점점 더 큰 물고기나 희귀물고기를 잡고자한다면
생각보다 다양한 애로사항들이 생겨나고(다소 빡칠 때도 종종), 이를 해결하기 위해 작전을 잘 짜야합니다
모자, 낚시대 업그레이드, 배, 보조도구 등도 너무 직선적이지 않고 어느정도 다양해서
그때 그때 전략적인 선택을 해야 수월한 낚시가 됩니다

그리고 생각보다 컨텐츠가 많아요 아직까지 물고기 도감을 다 못 채우고 70% 정도 채웠습니다
'아 이 정도면 이겜 얼추 다 해가는 듯?' 이라고 생각했을 떄, 50% 밖에 안 채워진 도감을 보고
'아직 절반이나 모르는 물고기가 더 있다고???' 충격 먹었습니다
물고기들도 단지 그림바꾸기 수준에서 그치는 것이 아니고, 후반가면 갈수록 특성들이 매우 다양해지고, 좀 더 다양한 접근법이 요구되어 재미가 계속 됩니다
탐험요소도 있고, 심해로, 원해로 가면 갈수록 고기 잡는 법들이 더 신박해집디다

공략법같은게 있는 지 모르겠지만 가능하면 그냥 게임 내의 설명만으로 맨땅에 헤딩하는 게 훨씬 재밌는 것 같습니다
하드코어한걸 좋아하지 않으시면 여간하면 낚시줄 안 끊어지는 클래식모드로 해도 충분히 만만찮습니다

7500원으로 이 정도면 아주 매우 갓겜이다라고 할 수 있겠습니다

30782217.review:
Cat Goes Fishing is a very relaxing fishing game. 

The fishing is very well though out in which you start out upgrading your fishing rod and then move on to buying a boat to get to deeper waters.

The game offers a very unique physics for the casting which help you cast either very far or just right in front of you. You always start with small bait and must catch a small fish then recast to catch a medium fish with which you can catch most large fish but some fish have certain requisites to catch them. (like using a puffer with a large hook to catch the swordfish). We also see the sadness of overfishing with one of the species in the game. If you fish a certain species they will be extinct. 

The visuals are very simplistic and colorful. The vast mayority of the fish are very distinguishable by their color and shape. 

The sounds and music are very well made. The underwater sounds resonate with the depth that your in and the music on the surface is quite tranquile. 

All in all you have a simplistic fishing game that is nice and tranquile for those afternoons when you just need to space out. Rod in one hand, a joint in the other.

8/10 for making me wanna live on the sea.

30200554.review:
简单模式全图鉴解锁特地来评价一下
这是我玩过的最有意思的钓鱼游戏，原来只觉得是一个加一游戏没想到让我玩了这么久
优点
1上手非常容易
2可以探索的内容非常多
3画风可爱
4耐玩

不足
1困难模式真的很难。。特别是开局，我这种简单模式全通的司机玩起来也是很吃力的（就是手残(*'へ'*)
2后期玩法比较单一，洞穴鱼的难度让人心累
3船和鱼竿并没有什么特别的特殊功能还是比较失望的
4bgm听多了有点单调

总之还是超喜欢的游戏，炒鸡推荐

游戏开始会有几个教程，之后只要跟着任务走就可以
前期的策略是先抓小鱼，只用50的小鱼去做饵钓中型鱼，450的黄鱼去做饵，掉到小鲨鱼建议卖掉
等到鱼竿到三级，获得那个小鱼不会吃大鱼的饵的技能后经济就会发展的很快了，钓大鱼很方便
等有了一定的积蓄后，建议优先买船，有了一级船后可以到达近海的边缘，会出现许多价值很高的小鱼和中型鱼
900的粉色小鱼性价比极高数量多，价格高，如果运气不错能钓到太阳帽的话就可以刷小鱼发家致富了
[b] 注意	[/b]船一定要满了再回去，满船会有一千的奖励，对于小鱼流很有用
前期没有多带炸弹的科技的话是不建议带炸弹的，效果很差还浪费钱
继续升级鱼竿后如果解锁了大钩后可以试试钓鲨鱼
鲨鱼是在近海活动，深度在浅海光亮区和深海黑暗区的分界处，先准备一个中型饵挂上大钩在岸边抛出，不用火箭，
在下沉的过程中让一条中型鱼咬钩后继续下沉，等快到分界线时鲨鱼会自己过来的，他的感知范围巨大，如果他刚好游到远处
稍等一会就好了，过程中注意躲避大鱼，主要是黄色快速大鱼和鲶鱼，抓到鲨鱼后会有64000的收入，还是很多的
游戏前期可以钓的巨型鱼还有maw和moga
Maw生活在深海，maw的嘴里有一条小的灯泡鱼，十分喜欢灯泡鱼，
具体钓法是
之前通过鲨鱼拖活鱼的特性探索，寻找maw的位置，找到后
保证鲨鱼的存活，用小饵钓挂大钩一条小的活鱼，不要收线让他继续下沉，在被鲨鱼咬到后鲨鱼不吃小鱼并不会不被勾住
会把小鱼拖到深海，这时小鱼变成了小饵，注意不要被其他鱼咬到，下沉到maw的位置，他嘴里的小鱼会去吃小饵被勾住
而maw回去吃跑掉的小灯泡而被大钩勾住，这样我们就钓到了一条maw
Moga是翻车鱼，生活在深海，惧怕灯泡和灯泡鱼（也就是怕光
具体钓法和maw差不多
先要多次挂灯探测，在深海灯的外围会出现一个闪来闪去的影子，那就是我们的moga了
找到地方后，我们用小鱼挂大钩，在被鲨鱼带到深海后，让一条蓝色中型鱼咬钩，记住整个过程不要灯泡
这时候moga会自己过来咬钩的（运气不好时咬钩的会是鲶鱼。。
注：以上方法都是前期适用，并不是钓这些鱼的唯一方法，后期装备大量炸弹，配合sink一样可以轻松掉到

等我们钓到了上面的大鱼，我们会有许多的积蓄，鱼竿可以买18w的，不建议买32w高级鱼竿的科技价格很高
性价比很低，所以买船才是发家致富的关键，在经过第一个雷雨夜后，我们会发现出现了一条剑鱼
剑鱼是我们除洞穴鲨鱼之外可以钓到的最贵的一条鱼了，价值40w，他价格高的吓人，可是却异常的好钓
剑鱼会解救上钩的小鱼，也就是用剑去戳走小鱼，我们近海的一片黄鱼之下有许多河豚，先去钓一条河豚，这时候剑鱼会来救他
然而他会被河豚卡住，这样我们就抓到他了

中期是游戏最容易的一个阶段，解锁了许多高价格的鱼，还有众多巨鱼可以钓，我们只要钓钓钓，升级船就可以了

到了游戏后期会出现几条很难抓的鱼，洞穴鲨鱼，阴和阳，还有壁虎鱼
洞穴鲨鱼:先装备sink，用炸弹沉到海底，勾住圆形石头，下潜到洞穴中，会有炸弹鱼自己附上来
找到洞穴鲨鱼他就会咬钩的，过程难点在于探索洞穴和快速下潜在灯泡用完前钓上他

阴阳:这是我认为游戏中难度最大的鱼，首先阴阳生活在距离两个很远的洞穴之中，他们并不会独自咬钩，只会跟着饵走
所以我们要把他们引导到一起，这需要很强的控制能力，第二阴阳属于小型鱼，会被鲨鱼之类的咬，很难完整拉出水面
不过最难的还是在于探索阴的位置，阴所在的洞穴在地图的右边，十分的大，很难找到她的位置

壁虎鱼:用活鱼大钩，难点在于通过狭小的岩石

技能的选择:我推荐双diving，配两个炸弹科技，一个小鱼不吃饵，加sink，其他可以带repel

Other than yarn, cats love fish! So instead of this cat waiting on it's master to give it fish, it'll give itself fish by fishing!

This is a game that's more about the atmosphere, casual play, and steady pacing. Not intended for rushing through the content, but to cast your line and hope you get a big one. The music is soothing and relaxing as well.

There is some strategy in play here, whether it's to lure or avoid fish, or try to get a specific fish. Be sure to keep an eye on your money too and try to make a profit per fish or load of fish. Buy a boat or better rods for bigger fish. Can even modified your rods for your own benefit.

The price is good, but wouldn't hurt to wait for a sale either.

Cat is gonna have a feast when he's done with this pond!

Try your luck in realism too!

Cat Goes Fishing je opravdu velmi jednoduchá hra, ve která za kočku s rybářským prutem lovíte různé druhy ryb. 22208916.review:
Кошак Собирается На Рыбалку

Если вы - кот и рыба для вас не просто любимое лакомство и источник кальция, а еще и способ приличного заработка, то хватайте удочку, садитесь в лодку и вперед к пополнению вашего банковского счета баснословными суммами вечнозеленых купюр) Но прежде чем вы лицезреете свое имя в списках Форбс, вам придётся постичь, тяжёлую долю рыбака - познать палящий зной дневного солнца и холод дождливых ночей, а скрашивать ваши суровые будни будут представители морской фауны в многочисленном своем разнообразии: от мелких рыбешек до огромных кровожадных акул. Последние изрядно потреплют вам нервы, раз за разом обрывая леску с заветной наживкой и дорогущим крючком (при условии, если вы играете в реалистичном режиме). Тем не менее, отчаиваться не стоит, потому как, рано или поздно, чудовище окажется на борту вашей лодки, а восторг от победного движения удочки на веки укрощающей строптивую тварь, возместит все неудобства: моральные и материальные, и даже останется на подоспевший к улову апгрейд. Апгрейдов не так много, но умелое обращение с ними может серьезно упростить задачу начинающего рыбака, а если и этого мало - вам в помощь головные уборы, время от времени, рандомно появляющиеся в водной стихии и после выуживания которых, вы приобретаете вспомогательные навыки - к примеру, способность на карте видеть квестовую рыбёху. 

Серьезного челенджа игра не предлагает, хотя и присутствует пара моментов "на подумать", связанных с определенной спецификой ловли некоторых, особенно неподатливых, рыб. Да и это испытание рассчитано на тех, кто желает остопроцентить игру в угоду статистике своего аккаунта и собственному самолюбию, для всех остальных игровой процесс сведется к занятному выуживанию рыбы в уютной домашней обстановке без разочарования в количестве улова.

Чуточку о графике.

Как и любая подобная игра, CGF не изобилует графическими составляющими и тем не менее действие, представляемое в ней выглядит очень достойно, учитывая 2D дизайн. Простоту картинки вытягивает мультяшная стилистика и приятная фоновая музыка. А что еще нужно нам простым рыбакам?)

В общем, кто хочет провести несколько умиротворяющих, и не очень, часов, за вытягиванием чешуйчатых обитателей из морских глубин - смело приобретайте Cat Goes Fishing и удачного вам клёва!)

The main thing going for Cat Goes Fishing is the art.

Fishing is, in reality, tedious and a waiting game. Unlike other reviewers, I'm not one to fault the game for being "grindy".

Players will notice, the object of this fishing game is more to attempt to keep your bait safe so you can get the fish you are after to bite.

The upgrades cost crazy in-game currency prices as that is the typical way of handling upgrades in this genre of game. Eventually everything is bought, all things are caught/collected,  and thus there is a wall.

This is a dollar mobile app type game not worth the asking price of several times that.

Mechanically it works. Artistically it looks good. But it's plain and lacking in simple features and innovation.

21372115.review:
All jokes aside I would rate this game a solid 9.8/10. 

This game is fantastically zen and is great for stress relief. You can play it for 5 minutes or 2 hours. I have found myself immersed in 2-3 hour sessions of this wonderful indie title.

[b] Pros: [/b]

- The art style is a perfect blend of cartoon and realism.

- The quests, although some can be extremely difficult, present a nice balance of challenge, objective, and progression.

- The developers are quick to patch bugs or errors and pay close attention to what the community has to offer. For examle, I posted a screenshot to show my friends that I had snagged my first legendary hat. I expressed that I felt that hat was slightly nerf. Within a week a developer had commented saying that next patch they would buff it. 

- The AI for the fish is so well build. Each one of the 40+ fish in the game have a unique fighting style when hooked. Also, some fish travel together, chase eachother, and some will protect their "leader." I would like to write more about the AI but it would take hours.

- The game progression is layed out perfectly, the larger, and harder to catch fish are father out at sea which requres the player to buy a boat, stronger fish are deeper, which requres the player to buy a better rod. The prices are layed out perfectly so when you dont get all the rods, then all the boats, air vice versa.

[b] Cons: [/b]

- The music can get a little repetitive, but this can easily be fixed. EDIT 1: Hat for new music was added :D

To be honest there arent that many cons :)

[b] Suggestions [/b]

- I feel this game could improve visually by adding in more customization options. These could include rod colors, boat, colors, boat names.

- Lastly, on realism mode I think a day night cycle could be cool. EDIT 1: Added

[h1] For 6.99 this game is 100% worth it! [/h1]

Wenn man dieses Spiel beschreibt, klingt es erstmal langweilig. Man spielt eine Katze, die angelt. Tatsächlich hat dieses Spiel aber einen echten Suchtfaktor für mich und man kann sich gerade in den höheren Leveln richtig darin verbeißen und muss auch mit einer gewissen Planung vorgehen.

Es gibt Fische in vier Größen und pro Größe verschiedene Arten. Manche treten in Schwärmen auf, andere einzeln. Manche beißen eher an als andere. Manche bringen mehr Geld als andere.
Die kleineren kann man jeweils verwenden, um damit die größeren Fische zu fangen.

Das verdiente Geld kann man in bessere Ausrüstung und hilfreiche Items umsetzen.

Das Gewässer verändert sich immer mal wieder und oft muss man es erstmal kennen lernen, um zu wissen. welche Fische wo sitzen und will man einen ganz bestimmten Fisch angeln, wie sorgt man dafür, dass ausgerechnet dieser anbeißt und nicht vorher ein anderer? 

Dazu kommt eine wahnsinnig entspannende Musik, die niemals langweilig wird.

Ein schönes Spiel für abends zum Runterkommen, oder so für zwischendurch oder nebenbei.
Klare Empfehlung von mir!

20253199.review:
[h1][b]Die Story:[/b][/h1]

Die Story lässt sich sehr gut zusammenfassen:
Eine Katze geht Angeln. Das wars auch schon.
Dieses Spiel handelt nur von einer Katze, die scheinbar alle ihre 9 Leben darauf verwendet, immer größere und seltenere Fische zu fangen. Dabei schaltet man immer mehr Gadgets und andere Hilfsmittel frei, mit denen man sich das Angelabenteuer erleichtern kann.

Die Story ist in diesem Spiel vernnächlässigbar, weshalb ich an dieser Stelle keine Bewertung abgeben will.


[h1][b]Das Gameplay:[/b][/h1]

Das Gameplay wirkt erstmal sehr abgestumpft und öde. Man holt mit der Angel aus, in dem man die linke Maustaste gedrückt hält und wirft sie aus, in dem man besagte Taste im richtigen Moment loslässt.
Hängt ein Fisch ander Angel, so kann man diesen einholen, in dem man erneut die linke Maustaste gedrückt hält.

Dieses System klingt zunnächst sehr langweilig.
Jedoch ist es wichtig, bei steigendem Schwierigkeitsgrad, seine Gadgets sinnvoll und an die Bedürfnisse angepasst einzusetzen. Dazu kommt ein fesselndes Levelsystem und eine irgendwie hypotisierende Titelmusik.

Alles in allem gebe ich dem Gesamtpaket 6/10 Punkten, da es eine wirklich nette Idee und auch eine gute Umsetzung hat, jedoch kommt man bei dem Spiel sehr schnell an die Grenzen, weshalb es auch schnell an Reiz verliert.


[h1][b]Meine Bewertung:[/b][/h1]

[b]Pro:[/b]
[list]
[*]Entspannende Atmossphäre durch Musik
[*]Ausgefeiltes Levelsystem
[*]Gute Steigerungskurve beim Schwierigkeitsgrad
[*]Leicht zu verstehende Gadgets
[/list]

[b]Kontra:[/b]
[list]
[*]Man hat schnell alles gesehen
[*]Kaum unterschied zwischen den beiden Spielmodi
[/list]


[h1][b]Mein Fazit:[/b][/h1]

An sich ist das Spiel eine nette Abwechslung, wenn man nach einem actiongeladenem Ego-Shooter mal komplett abschalten will. Für den Preis von 6.99€ ist es auch für die nicht all zu prall gefüllten Geldbeutel immernoch erschwinglich. Jedoch sollte man beim Kauf bedenken, dass dieses Spiel sehr stark beschränkt ist und man schon nach etwa 15 Spielstunden "am Ende" sein kann.

Insgesamt habe ich mich auf 5/10 Punkten festgelegt. Es hat zwar viele gute Eigenschaften, jedoch lassen mich die Einfachheit des Spiels und die starken Einschränkungen bezüglich Langlebigkeit des Spielspaßes viele Abzüge machen.


[i][b]Dieses Review wurde als Wertung innerhalb des eigenen Genres verfasst.[/b]

Wenn euch diese Review gefallen hat, dann folgt unserem Reviewprogramm auf [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/-German_Gamer_Community-]German_Gamer_Community[/url][/i]

19399643.review:
Typical flash game fare.  Do the thing, unlock things that make it easier to do the thing, do the thing more.  Unfortunately, it suffers from unfocused game design, and leads to a lot of frustration.

There are four different sizes of fish, each having a minimum size of bait required to catch them -- but ALL fish go after and try to steal ALL bait, not just bait their own ranking.  The only way to get this bait is by catching a fish of one rank, and throwing it back in to get bait of the next rank.  Lastly, any time you're pulling a fish in, any larger fish it passes will nibble on it, damaging your catch and lowering its value (and making it not count towards quests - though it can still be bait).  This bait system works against itself in the worst, least productive way.

So let's say you catch a small fish.  You throw it back in as Medium Bait, and start trauling for bigger -- oops, no, another small fish ate it.  You start pulling in your new small fish, and the medium fish you were trying to catch darts in and eats half of it before you can get it back on board.  So you throw it back as medium bait, and try again.  Three attempts later, you finally catch your first medium fish.  You throw it back as Large bait, aiming to hook a big one -- oops, no, the cheapest variety of small fish just ate your bait, and then got eaten to the bones by a medium fish again.  And you have a quest to catch three large fish, and the game will not progress until you manage.

Unfortunately this ruins it as a casual experience, adding difficulty via grinding.  I'm holding out hope for an eventual upgrade that will make it go away, but it's not in sight yet.  I'll change the review if I find it.  Example upgrades that could turn it around if they exist :
- the ability to buy bait of the desired size
- permanent upgrade that raises the minimum rank of your bait
- permanent upgrade that makes fish on your line immune to being nibbled on on the way back
- making fish stop stealing bait too low rank for them
- making fish stop biting bait too high rank for them

..but really, it would be better if one of those things were available from the start.

So, this game is pretty cute.  The premise is simple enough, and described perfectly in the title - you are a cat who has gone fishing, and your goal is to amass tasty fish, sell them for better gear, and collect cool hats which impact your game.  The sound effects are really cute (especially Cat's disgruntled rumble when you bring up an empty hook), and the game's missions are straightforward and help you build up to bigger, better items.

With that being said, it gets stale pretty fast.  I haven't even caught every fish in the game, but my interest has fizzled down to 'I'll play it while I'm waiting to hear back from my friend' or 'ugh, I don't have time to play something involved before I have to leave...I'll play CGF'.  Given my usual desperation to fill out lists, this is a bad sign.  Still, if you grab it when it's on sale, it's adorable and casual, and not an awful way to spend fifteen minutes.

На вырученные от продажи рыбы деньги вы сможете улучшить свою удочку, например, повесить отпугиватель какого-то вида мелкой рыбы, чтобы приманка благополучно доплыла до рыбы покрупнее и подороже.Так же можно приобрести более крепкий и хороший спиннинг, красивую шляпу или даже лодку, на которой можно заплыть далеко от берега и ловить более редкую рыбешку.                                                                                                                                                   По мере того как вы вылавливаете все больше рыбы, ваш уровень увеличивается и открывается доступ к более мощным удилищам и прочим полезным предметам. В конечном итоге вы даже можете попытать удачу в ловле глубинных обитателей морей, кто знает насколько страшными и сильными они могут быть.Помимо стандартных наживок, вы так же можете прибегнуть к браконьерству и прикрепить взрывчатку вместо наживки, чтобы оглушить рыбу.
Помимо стандартных наживок, вы так же можете прибегнуть к браконьерству и прикрепить взрывчатку вместо наживки, чтобы оглушить рыбу.

18237569.review:
Unsurprisingly you are a cat and you are fishing: you'll start from the bank and slowly buy upgrades, new poles and even boats with the money you get from selling fish you catch.
Cat Goes Fishing is a pretty charming game with a cute premise, decent gameplay and a good amount of stuff to do: sadly it can get repetitive fast and its progression is a tad too slow.

[b]PROS:[/b]

-while very simple the graphics sport a charming art style

-good amount of different fish to catch

-quite many upgrades, things to buy and hats providing bonuses to be fished out of the water

-two different game modes, one being more laid back while the other features a breakable line

[b]CONS:[/b]

-simple music gets repetitive quite fast

-quests can't be abandoned, thus if you get one requiring a fish you can't/ aren't able to catch you're going to get stuck for a possibly long time

-gameplay can get frustrating, even with upgrades having to cast in the right place, wiggling your lure between useless fish, hoping the right one will be hooked and that no other fish will take a bite while you reel it in can be challenging: having to do so several times and failing will teste your nerves and ruin the relaxing atmosphere the game wants to create

-unlocks eventually get too pricey, requiring lots of grinding

-no way to save and exchange hats, you can only equip one and have to sell those you don't wish to keep 

-some things aren't explained, for example what the different fishing pole stats actually do

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=468249937

Cat Goes Fishing is a decent game overall, I had fun for a few hours trying to catch fish, getting a nice hat, unlocking stuff and then trying to get a shark eat my bait: it's charming, has novelty value and can easily make you go "just one more fish before I quit".

Sadly all this eventually grinds to a halt when you realize that the high end upgrades are very pricey, we're talking about a range from 250k to 320k when many big fishes can be sold for 7k: add to this the fact that you'll often have to also buy one time bonuses (rockets to go deeper, bombs to scare away the first fish that bites etc) not to mention having to rebuy upgrades for each new pole and you'll see how this can eventually get tiring.

I was a bit torn overall but ultimately decided for a thumbs up due to the fact I had some decent fun with it and the game will do the same for you  for at least a few hours provided you don't mind its shortcomings, just don't be surprised when it loses its charm: if you're interested I'd get it on sale.

Okay I will be the first to admit that people slap Cat on to something and call it a day and it sells like hot cakes. It has become almost a trend in gaming to put a Cat or funny animal into an unusual role and forget the importance of game design. When it comes to Cat Gone Fishing, the adorable aesthetic aside. The game is very well designed and highly addictive. Yes, it's a cat holding a fishing rod and it is adorable but that aside the core gameplay of Cat Goes Fishing is what I enjoyed most about this game. With dozens of upgrades available for your rod, boat, radar and more, you will turn your Cat into a fishing machine as you begin to battle the monsters underneath the surface. Cat Goes Fishing is a wonderful game to just load up and completely just fall into and relax while you play it, discovering even more aquatic animals after you think you've found everything. The only true complaint I could have about the game is it's lack of options, Cat Goes Fishing shows its mobile roots with no shame. While this may be disconcerting to some, I found the positives of this fun and adorable game to far outweigh the bad. Besides, guys, it's a Cat wearing a hat and fishing! Come on! It's adorable!!

18028242.review:
カジュアル釣りゲーム。
釣竿よりも網を使えと言わんばかりの大量の魚がいる海で、主人公の猫を操作してひたすら釣りをする作業ゲームだ。
操作は簡単、マウスボタン長押しで竿を振りはじめ任意のところでボタンを離すとルアーの飛距離が調整でき、目的の魚を狙えるようにマウスボタンを押しリールを巻いてエサを誘導し、魚がかかったら糸が切れないようにリールを巻き取るだけのシンプル操作だ。釣った魚を売る以外に指定の魚を釣るクエストで金が手に入り、釣竿や船を購入してさらに大物を釣っていくというのが主な流れだ。コレクトすることはできないが様々な効果を持つ帽子も釣ることができる。

[魚の種類]
意外と種類は豊富で小型魚、中型魚、大型魚、巨大魚とカテゴライズされており、動きや特徴が差別化されている。小さい魚はより大きな魚のエサとなり、巨大魚を釣るには高価なフックが必要だ。

[漁場]
固定マップで魚の出現ポイントが決まっている。ただし、広い範囲で動き回っている魚がいるので注意。図鑑の魚の特徴とレーダーをよく見ていれば魚のおおよその位置の見当はつくようになってくる。船をアップグレードしていくことで右奥の海域へと進むことが段階的に可能になり、釣れる魚の種類も増えていく。

穏やかなBGMで淡々とプレイすることができるが作業ゲームということに変わりがなく、「大物を釣りたい」または「釣りたい魚がある」などの目的がなければ長続きしないゲームだと思う。それでも短時間でサクッと遊ぶにはいいゲーム性を持っている。もちろん全ての大物を釣り上げたいという人ならカジュアルなつくりながらも意外と長く楽しむことができると思う。

17929771.review:
A simple, but entertaining time killer. Cat Goes Fishing is a fishing simulator from Cat5Games. Let’s get rocking.

The Good

Cat Goes Fishing gets everything just about perfect. The controls are as simple as they come and you won’t even need a tutorial to figure them out. If you did, you’d probably be some sort of mollusk…and not one of the smart ones.

There is a delightful plethora of fish for you to catch. The small fries can be caught without any special baiting, but, the further up the scale you move, the bigger the bait you’re going to need to attract your Moby Dick’s interest.

There are several items for you to purchase that will aid you in your fishing endeavors. You can get new rods (and upgrades for each of them), you can buy boats to take you out further onto the lake, you can get a sonar to show you where fish are in the lake, and much more.

The boats were especially useful. Some fish only appear further out in the lake and, so, would be unreachable without a boat of some kind. The boat also lets you store a finite amount of fish so that you can sell them when you get back to shore.

CGF offers the player “quests” to complete. This results in the player gaining experience and working towards a level up to unlock more gear, but it also fights back at the repetitiveness of the game itself. When you’re given a goal to work towards, you don’t get bored quite as much.

The Bad

Inevitably, CGF does become repetitive. There’s only so much digital fishing one can do before they get tired of it.

The Meh

CGF also has hats for you to find in the depths and equip your character with. The hats are absurdly hard to find and you rarely come across one at a moment when you could actually try and snag it with your hook.

Verdict: Yea

Cat Goes Fishing is fun, but it’s more of a novelty game for killing time. If you see it go on sale, by all means, buy it. It’s worth of few bucks. You can find it in the Steam Store. As always, thanks for reading.

17738755.review:
[h1]"Should I buy a boat? Or should I buy a radar?" [/h1]

These are very important questions for the cat.  

Cat Goes Fishing is a cute, slow pace game that requires just enough brain power to keep one occupied and unwind. Just like other players have mentioned, the game is not without its mini challenges such as .. catching the right fish.

[b]Goes well with Stravinsky... or other music: Create your own Playlist[/b]

It's not exactly part of the game, but it can certainly be so! I'm sure quite a few players would find the repeating background tunes a bit tiresome.  As a result, I matched one of my fishing activities to, of all things, [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=54bsXQhCBOg]Igor Stravinsky's "Petrushka"[/url] . The whole experience got 3x more exciting and whimsical.  Of course some mellower tunes like John Coltrane would yield a more chill game.

[b]Some of my overall positve experience[/b]
[list]
[*]Very easy to learn and navigate
[*]Fish CATalog:  Or is it a Fish-a-log?  Keeps track of names & characteristics of your catch, convenient for quests
[*]The satisfaction of catching fish that are over 3x the cat's size on a tiny boat.
[*]How well it functions on the "I'm going to get you, stupid fish!!!!" psychology
[*]Cute & Colourful Designs:  The colour coordination and fishy distribution relate to each other really well!!  
[*]SoundFx: The different sounds beween the depths of water... also the Cat's grumpy meow is pretty awesome.
[/list]

[b]Conclusion:[/b]
Take our monies.

15581273.review:
Cat Goes Fishing est un petit jeu casual qui n'a l'air de rien comme ça mais qui se révèle être assez addictif. Vous commencez avec une simple canne à pêche puis au fur et à mesure vous pourrez débloquer des améliorations, des cannes à pêche plus puissantes, des bateaux pour pêcher en haute mer... http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=433158319 Le gameplay est ultra simple : vous devez attraper de petits poissons puis en les transformant en appât vous en attraperez de plus gros. Attention car les plus gros viendront manger votre poisson et il faudra essayer de les éviter grâce à la mini-map. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=433157645 Il sera aussi possible d'attraper des chapeaux qui confèrent un bonus (plus de gains, plus d'une mission active, certains poissons comptent double...etc). Les poissons sont d'ailleurs assez variés et vous aurez besoin d'un catalogue pour les reconnaitre et mener à bien vos quêtes. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=433158121 La prise en main est très intuitive, seule la souris est nécessaire hormis pour déplacer le bateau. 

Au final il y en a pour de longues heures de jeu car les améliorations ne s'obtiennent pas aussi rapidement que l'on pourrait le croire. Avec sa [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mREooFwXR80]musique douce[/url], c'est un petit jeu sympa mais pas exceptionnel non plus, il y en a du même type en Flash gratuits sur le web, à ce niveau là je trouve que 6.99€ c'est un peu cher. Si vous comptez débloquer toutes les améliorations il y en a pour une dizaine d'heures donc là ça vaut le coup, à vous de juger.

15385578.review: It's an average game that is reminiscent of those crappy Flash games where you just keep buying more upgrades to get further in. At first it's kind of zen, you just hook fish from the water. Then it starts getting more complicated - you catch a small fish which you use as bait for bigger ones, which can then be used to catch the biggest ones. The problem is that the water is filled pretty densely with fish and fish you don't care about will constantly take the bait instead. So many times I made a large bait and then threw it in only for it to immediately be taken by a tiny fish near the surface. Additionally bigger fish can bite at smaller fish caught on your line and if they do, the fish you caught won't count for any quests you have. You can buy upgrades to counter some of these issues but after the first few they are extremely expensive.

15304975.review:
Pretty simple, casual 2D fishing simulator. Visuals are nice, animations are fine, and music is okay to listen to for a while (then press M to turn it off). Upgrades come in pretty quickly at first, then mid-game there is a lot of unrewarded gold grind while you save for better rods + upgrades, boats, and other upgrades. Quests are decent gold but you can easily get stuck on a quest if you haven't gotten the proper rod/upgrades yet. Also, fish take time to respawn so you may have to wait for the fish you want (or get a boat to increase your fishing range). At end-game once you can grind the shark/maw/anglerfish, gold comes in quickly enough to upgrade everything you want and more.

Fishing is pretty straightforward: catch a small fish to catch a medium fish to catch a large/huge fish while avoiding fish you don't want to catch. I upgraded reel speed and lure sink speed to better avoid fish I didn't want to take. The Bait Guard and Crankbait upgrades are really useful, but are also very expensive to grind. Minimap and radar upgrades are nice for avoiding unwanted fish, though you can throw your line beyond the radar (which might be fixed in the beta). Radar is also useful for finding where the Maw/Anglerfish spawn and where you can cast to avoid the most fish on the way down.

Pretty fun for a 2D fishing simulator, though I would've liked more special fish like the shark. The shark takes your live fish and drags your line further away, effectively extending your rod's reach further than you normally could go. It's pretty fun to use when you're starting out with mediocre rods and no boat, but I don't think there's any more sharks further out so everything beyond the initial screen is just simple fishing.

Who wouldn't like a hat wearing cat that can secure his own dinner? It's a super fun and super cute game! It's a quick, no brainer, casual experience that fills the the need to play a game when you don't have enough time to play one. 

I still haven't mastered how to properly fling my rod though. A few times I'm able to make the thing really fly out there but I don't  know how to replicate that. But I'm still able to catch the fish I want, provided the other dumb fisH don't get to it first. :P Luckily, there are upgrades you can buy to keep those pesky fish at bay. :) 

Speaking of upgrades, that's another dynamic of the game I like. You can complete quests AND score some cash by catching fish. With that cash you are able to buy a better rod, an upgrade so your boat can leave dock, and other random things like a rocket to shoot your line out farther. I give this game a thumbs up and a good recommendation for those that are really into mindless fun.

This is a ridiculously cute and relaxing game.  Cute and relaxing does not also mean boring, however.  There's always things to work towards (catching certain fish, acquiring new gear, etc.). I was honestly surprised that there's enough to strive for in Cat Goes Fishing to keep me interested.  The amount of money you earn is reasonable for what you catch/how difficult the fish is to catch, and you earn it at a good rate, too.  This means when you're eyeing that $50,000 boat, it won't be days until you have it; you will probably be able to earn the cash in half an hour, 45 minutes (or less if you don't purchase certain items that enhance your casting, like rockets. Finally, the music is simple and pretty, and rounds out the relaxing gameplay perfectly. For under $7.00, it is well worth the purchase.

14778291.review:
It’s reel good. The menu has a paws function. You have to sea it. I had a whale of a time. I'm hooked.
 
I'm sorry.

Let’s give an actual review:

Cat Goes Fishing is literally a game where you are a cat and you cast your line into the water and grab a fish. The water is full of types of fish, all with different attributes. Generally, you start by getting a small fish, then you use that as bait to get a bigger fish and so on. Then you sell the fish and buy upgrades, like a big rod and a boat. To increase variety and give goals, the game has an optional quest system that ranges from easy to difficult.
 
It’s addictive and simple, but has everything you would want for this type of thing. The constant upgrades and range of fish types give the game more variety.

I suppose my only criticism is that being a cat has almost zero effect on the game. The protagonist could have been a person and that wouldn't have changed anything.

THIS GAME IS FANTASTIC WORTH EVERY CENT!
At first I thought this would be a simple and easy game, and oh boy I was wrong.

When you get the hang of it, you'll notice a pattern to the game. You'll start  to memorize where a certain type of fish will spawn, you'll start to incorporate bombs and rockets just to catch a certain type of fish and you will find your own preference of rod modification to suit your own fishing method.

This game turns out to be very addictive and surprisingly very challenging (it took me 2 hours just to catch my first Mew shark). But once you get all the steam achievements and amass tonnes of wealth I found out that the replayability of the game is awful, its just another cycle of catching a fish, reel it in and repeat. 

There should be an option where 
1) The cat can purchase a plane and hop off onto another island (that has rare and exotic fish perhaps?)

3) The cat would get hungry and would like to eat a certain type of fish

9.5/10

Eres un gato. Y tienes una caña de pescar. De modo que lanzas el anzuelo, capturas un pez y lo vendes (sí, eres un felino mercantilista). O no. Porque también puedes usar ese pez como cebo para capturar otros más grandes. Como eres un gato con ínfulas de inversor, usas el dinero para mejorar la caña y la plomada, y así pescar mejor.

¿Qué tiene de gracioso todo esto? Si eres una persona normal, nada. Si eres uno de esos bichos raros a quien le gusta la pesca, quizás te interese. Y si encima te gustan los gatos, disfrutarás por partida doble.

No obstante,si no encajas en ninguno de los infragrupos sociales anteriores, el juego te aburrirá. Es más. Incluso si te gusta pescar, acabarás hasta las narices de este juego. ¿Por qué? Porque no tiene nada más. Es un juego gráficamente paupérrimo (en serio, es una basura visual), en donde todo se reduce a presionar y soltar el botón izquierdo del ratón para lanzar el cebo y recogerlo. No hay más.

¿Por qué entonces la gente da notas tan altas a esta bobada? Porque son idiotas. Tiene narices que la tecnología haya llegado tan lejos para acabar entretenidos con esta tontería que tiene menos calidad que la mayoría de los juegos hechos en Flash.

Para que te hagas una idea, una Master System le da sopas con honda a esta bobada.

Cómpralo si quieres demostrar a tus amigos que tus padres cometieron un error al tener descendencia.

Si no te gusta mi análisis, te aguantas.

At the price point offered for this game, I don't think it's worth the time & money to get this game.

The experience and gameplay is indeed challenging. It requires a little bit of reflex, planning and skill to overcome the missions/objectives. You'll get frustrated when the medium/large fishes start biting in on your haul, as you reel in your hard-earned fish to sell, only to find it missing a tail.

Pretty straight-forward, and the fish do not relatively move a large distance, so you can expect the same cluster of fish to be hanging out in the same areas. Once you memorize their approximate locations, it becomes less of a random experience like how real-life fishing is, but becomes repetitive execution.

Can probably be improved. I had fun, I don't deny that, but at the price, I think other titles within the same genre offer a better experience than this one, albeit being unique.

14283978.review:
What a surprising little gem.
The mechanics are simple: just click to cast and hold to reel in!

The artwork, while almost elementary, is cute, clean, and consistent. It serves the purpose well; simple and cute artwork for a simple and cute game.

Despite the simplicity of the controls, there is actually a perfect amount of difficulty instituted here. You've got to craftily avoid smaller fish to get to the bigger ones, or combo the smaller ones as bait for larger and larger fish. The better the fish, the more money you get for them. Money is spent on an assortment of fishing rods, powerups for each rod, boats, and even extras like one-use bombs and larger hooks. The balance in the game seems perfect; even hours later, I'm still catching new fish and have only unlocked half the rods and boats and powerups, and I'm still getting new quests for bonus money.
Oh, and you can catch adorable hats for your cat to wear which give different bonuses!

The only thing I can't seem to find is an options menu, but the sounds and music are so unobtrusive that for most people it might not matter much.

14282877.review:
As you might have guessed, this game is about fishing !

You are a cat, and your goal is to catch as many fish as possible. This is how you do : firstly, catch a small fish, then use it as a bait to catch a medium one, and finally use the new bait to catch a large fish. The challenge is there : getting the big fish (shark, maw, ...) is not a piece of cake ! 

You will be rewarded with money by selling fish and completing quests. With money, you can buy new rods (+ upgrades, 8 different kinds, choose wisely), some useful devices/items (rockets, bombs, ...) and boats that allow you to catch more kind of fish by navigating on the sea.

You will also find hats while fishing : you can only wear one, so choose wisely in order to get the bonus you want ! You cannot stock them, you can only keep the one that you are wearing. Tip : I think the best one to wear is the baseball cap, because being able to have two quests at the same time is great, especially if you are stuck with one, since you cannot drop it.

In the end, this game is simple but pretty fun, even though it is a little bit grindy if you want to unlock everything and get all of the achievements.

14263132.review:
Cat Goes Fishing is a fun and relaxing fishing game where you take control of a Cat (never would have guessed) who's trying to catch the biggest fish he/she can. The game is still being worked on by its developer (I think) so hopefully the game's negative aspects will be ironed out soon.

+Simple graphics
+Lots of upgrades to equipment and lots of new equipment can be unlocked as you progress through the game
+Quite a lot of different fish types
+You can 'catch' hats which give you special perks or can be sold for a small profit
+Great game for killing time and it's very relaxing
+The game autosaves when you quit so you don't have to worry about saving the game all the time
+Catching a big fish that you've been after for a while is very satisfying
+You can unlock boats which allow you to travel further from the shore and catch more expensive fish

-Progression in the game is slow and painful, earning enough money for the hugely expensive fishing rods and other equipment take very long times
-Hats can't be saved, if you get a new one you have to pick
-Little fish can eat medium and large bait (you can get a rod upgrade to stop them eating large bait) which is incredibly frustrating
-Some of the fishing rod upgrades feel like they have no effect
-This game has no options of any kind and is stuck in 1024x768 making it look pretty bad on big screens when in full screen (full screen can only be achieved by using ALT+ENTER)
-Quests are dull and repetitive

Verdict:
6

A reasonably fun casual fishing game that is best played in short bursts to kill some time.

El K.

14174184.review:
To start, love this game.

The appearance is clean, crisp, colorful and easy on the eyes even after long periods of game play. Even the fact it is windowed doesn't bother me! This is a very pleasant and easy going game (though can be sort of frustrating when trying to catch specific fish!) that isn't confusing and yet has a decent amount of depth for it's simplicity.

The cat that goes fishing is cute in all of the little hats you unlock throughout the game, each giving you a bonus to some random fishing affect (small fish worth more, rockets cost less, etc). There are different kinds of rods that also have bonuses that you can pay to get equipped to them (such as faster lure sink). There are a few other fun features that give this game a playful, meaningful and yet simple to understand, feel that can be enjoyed by pretty much anyone.

If you are looking for a relaxing game that doesn't cause you to obsessively keep track of every detail, a game that helps you unwind from a hectic day, this might be for you.

If you are looking for a game that has mild strategy, a fishy smell and a furry protagonist, this is for you.

If you broke your thumb and two fingers on your left hand, no worries. You only need to press A and D with that hand and have your right for the mouse!

There's surprisingly quite a bit packed into this little package and it's definitely worth the (sale) price I paid for it. Especially the sense of pride and accomplishment as your cute little kitty reels in a monster shark.

After all that, the only fault I have found in this whole game is the fact I can't upgrade the upgrades to my pole. But it isn't a drawback really, just expected it to be an extended feature and was surprised it wasn't. ^^

It -can- get repetitive, but I enjoy that sort of gameplay just as much as I like gameplay with constant changes. But just a heads up for those who get tired of a bit of repetition.

14171625.review:
There is very little to distinguish this title from free fishing games.  It may be cute, but the grind gets old fast.

For example, let's take the bait mechanics.  Catching a small fish is easy enough, but if you want to catch medium fish, you must first catch a small fish and recast it.  To catch a large fish, you must catch a small fish, recast it as bait, catch a medium fish with that, and recast that one too.  If the wrong size of fish bites down, it can send you backward and make you repeat some or all of these steps.  Why can't we just buy or save medium and large bait?  True, there are hats and upgrades that can help with this eventually, but they don't eliminate what feels like unnecessary tedium.

Overall, I gave this game a chance, but left feeling more frustrated than I did relaxed.  For that reason, I would not recommend it.

Cat Goes Fishing is a nice balance between cute, entertaining, and challenging. It's an ideal game if you just want to kick back in your pajamas and do some fishing. There's a certain satisfaction to be had when you catch your first hat or snag a particularly elusive fish.

There's a small amount of strategy involved as you upgrade/equip gear in order to go after whatever you're actively trying to catch. You also end up using some creative reeling in order to avoid undesirable fish.

Important tip! Press "M" to mute the music once you grow tired of it and would rather listen to Pink Floyd while you troll the deeps for those profitable fishies. Also, there is no "exit" option. It's a mobile port, so just hit the X because it saves on the fly.

Relax, get a drink, and catch some dang fish :)

I was looking for something cute and relaxing to play and, while the asthetic is quite good, I found the gameplay to be quite frustrating and grind heavy. All of this soon becomes tiresome and it feels like they do not give you the tools you need to alleviate these issues unless you are willing to grind yout way up high in game money walls. I soon lost interest in my dreams of fishing as a cat but I'm sure one day they will be realised.

"Cat Goes Fishing"

น้องแมวตกปลา น้องแมวในเกมนี้สีเหมือนแมวที่บ้านผมเลยว่ะ ไม่อยากจะโม้ ใครอยากเห็นทักแชทมาได้เลยครับ :3

Gameplay :
น้องแมวตกปลา แน่นอนว่าน้องแมวต้องไปตกปลา แต่น้องแมวที่ไหนมีแรงเยอะพอที่จะดึงฉลามเป็นๆขึ้นมาได้ โดยที่น้องแมวใช้แค่แรงมือ สงสัยเล่นกล้ามบ่อย
Gameplay สรุปเป็นหัวข้อย่อยๆได้ดังนี้
1.Rod ไม้ตกปลา
มีตั้งแต่ขั้น Basic จนถึงขั้น Master 
โดยแต่ละขั้นก็จะมี Upgraded ให้อัพให้มันเทพขึ้นได้ แต่ Upgraded ก็แพงใช่ย่อย
2.อุปกรณ์เสริม หมวก เรือ
อุปกรณ์เสริมก็จะมีพวก Radar ไว้ส่องหาปลา ส่วนหมวกก็จะมีความสามารถของมันเอง โดยจะแตกต่างกันไป 
ส่วนเรือเอาไว้ล่องได้ เผื่อจะไปตกปลาไกลๆ
3.ปลา
ปลาใหญ่ย่อมกินปลาเล็กเป็นแน่แท้
ตอนแรกที่คุณโยนเหยื่อไป คุณสามารถจับได้แค่ปลาเล็กเท่านั้น หากปลาใหญ่กว่านี้มากิน ก็ไม่ติดมาแน่นอน
หลังจากเราจับปลาเล็กได้แล้ว เราเลือกได้สองอย่างว่าจะขาย หรือจะเอาไปเป็นเหยื่อให้ปลาขนาดกลางกิน หลังจากปลาขนาดกลางกินแล้ว เราก็เลือกได้สองอย่างเหมือนเดิม คือจะขายหรือจะเอาไปเป็นเหยื่อสำหรับปลาตัวใหญ่ ปลาตัวใหญ่ขายได้ราคาดีมากกกก

ปลาตัวใหญ่ไม่พอ ต้องมีโคตรใหญ่ คือปลาฉลามกับปลา The Maw (ราคาแพงโคตรครับ 50,000)
ปลาฉลามจะกินปลาขนาดกลางพร้อมกับต้องมี Huge Hook ที่ใช้ได้แค่ครั้งเดียวต่อการโยนหนึ่งครั้ง และปลาฉลามกินเฉพาะเหยื่อที่ยังมีชีวิตเท่านั้น หากเรามีแต่เหยื่อ ไม่มี Huge Hook เราจะโดนลากไปใต้น้ำลึก (เฉพาะเหยื่อนะ น้องแมวไม่ได้โดนลากลงมา) แล้วก็ถูกปล่อย จากเหยื่อมีชีวิตก็จะกลายเป็นเหยื่อไม่มีชีวิต
The Maw จะกินเฉพาะปลาตัวใหญ่ที่มีชีวิต + Huge Hook

Texture :
อันนี้ไม่ได้เน้นด้านความสวย,รายละเอียด แต่ก็ใช้ได้นะครับ
Texture ที่ทำมาก็เหมาะสำหรับเกมนี้แล้ว

สรุปครับ
ซื้อเลยครับ ไว้เล่นว่างๆได้ สนุกดี 170 บาท ถ้าไม่ลด (ถ้าผมจำไม่ผิดราคาประมาณนี้ครับ) ไม่แพงมาก ซื้อเลยยย

14155656.review:
낚시 게임. 물고기를 건져 판매한 금액으로 장비를 점차 업그레이드하고, 더 가치 있는 물고기를 잡으며 물고기 도감을 다 채우는 게임.

 우선 간단하고 간결한 그래픽이 눈에 들어오는데, 한가로운 분위기의 배경 음악과 잘 어울린다. 게임의 구조 역시 간결해서 몇 차례 고기를 낚다 보면 게임이 돌아가는 원리는 금세 파악할 수 있다. 물고기를 잡아 팔고, 판돈으로 더 비싼 장비를 사고, 더 비싼 물고기, 더 희귀한 물고기를 잡는 식이다.

 단순히 물고기만 잡는 것은 따분할 것을 염려했는지, 물고기와 관련된 임무 역시 제공하고 있다. 특별한 아이템을 몇 회 사용하거나, 특정 물고기를 몇 마리 낚는 등의 간단한 임무다. 물론, 진행하면 할수록 특정 물고기를 낚는다는 것이 쉽지만은 않다는 것을 알 수 있다. 쉽지 않기 때문에 특정 임무에서 막힌 채 진행이 곤란하게 될 수도 있다. 임무가 막힌다고 게임 전체의 진행이 막혀버리는 것은 아니지만, 진행의 목적이 희미해지고, 정체된 느낌이 들기 때문에 플레이어에게 결코 좋은 상황은 아닐 것이다. 그래서 이 부분을 보완하기 위해서 다른 방법을 준비해두었다.

 게임의 진행에 도움이 되는 장비들로는 우선 낚싯대가 있고, 일회성 혹은 단시간 사용할 수 있는 도움 아이템이 있다. 그 외에 보트가 있고, 특정 개수의 임무를 완수하면 해금할 수 있는 특수 장비도 있다. 낚싯대는 낚싯대 자체에 업그레이드를 통해 취향껏 사용할 수 있고, 도움 아이템으로는 미끼를 멀리 날려 보낼 수 있는 폭죽, 상어를 낚아 올릴 수 있는 큰 갈고리 등이 있다. 보트는 섬에서 좀 더 나아가 낚시를 할 수 있도록 돕고, 특수 장비에는 작은 지도나 레이더 장비 등이 있다. 이들 장비는 레벨이나 임무를 통해 해금한 뒤에 구매할 수 있지만, 구매할 수 없는 장비도 있다. 그것이 바로 '모자'이다. 바닷속에 가끔 모자가 등장하는데, 물고기를 낚듯이 모자를 낚아 올리면 된다. 각각의 모자는 특별한 효과가 있어서, 진행에 도움을 준다. 가령 모자 'Fez'는 큰 물고기의 가치를 50% 더 받을 수 있는 대신, 작은 물고기가 좀 더 공격적으로 바뀌는 효과가 있다. 앞서 임무의 진행이 막힐 때를 대비해 준비해둔 장치가 있다고 했는데, 그것이 모자다.

 임무는 보통 한 개씩밖에 받을 수 없는데, 어떤 모자를 쓰면 임무를 한 가지 더 받을 수 있기 때문이다. 이 모자를 이용해 돈을 좀 더 수월히 벌 수 있기 때문에 적당한 모자를 찾아서 쓰고 있는 것이 진행에 있어 중요하다고 할 수 있다. 모자는 보관할 수 없고, 쓰거나 팔거나 둘 중 하나이기 때문에 필요할 때마다 골라 쓸 수는 없다.

 아담한 용량이지만 그 내용은 꽤 알차다. 물고기의 종류도 꽤 다양하게 해두었고, 오래 플레이할 만한 요소도 잘 배치해두었다. 도전 과제도 대부분 장비의 해금과 관련되어 있어 진행하다 보면 크게 어려움 없이 달성할 수 있다. 하지만 장비의 가격이나 장비의 업그레이드 가격이 진행하면 할수록 벌이보다 너무 급격히 비싸지고, 별다른 장면의 전환 없이 비슷한 곳에서 맴돌면서 반복적인 행동을 자주 하게 되기 때문에 쉽게 지루해진다. 시간을 두고, 조금씩 진행하면 그럭저럭 재미있게 할 수 있겠지만, 단기간에 게임을 모두 깨기는 쉽지 않을 것 같다. 임무 역시도 '모자'를 통해 그나마 진행을 원활히 할 수 있게 해놓았다고 하긴 했지만, 너무 갑자기 잡아야 하는 물고기의 수준이 올라서 오랜 시간 임무는 시작조차 못 한 채 다른 반복적인 행위만 하게 되기 쉽다. 임무의 안배와 각종 장비의 가격을 좀 더 신중히 배분해두었다면, 즐겁게 게임 전체를 즐길 수 있었을 것 같다는 아쉬움이 남는다.

14129383.review:
I think the title adequately explains what the game is about.

This is the kind of game you play while you're waiting to do something else. The art is friendly and colorful. There's 1 music track (turn it off by pressing M) that you can hear in the trailer. The actual game is simple and fun. When you cast your line, you control where the bait moves. Then when you hook a fish, you have to reel it back while avoiding the other fish that may want to eat it. You'll have to use a different type of strategy to catch each fish.

There's a leveling system where you can buy and upgrade things with the money from the fish you catch. It's a bit clunky and annoying to use, but I didn't feel that it took away from the game at all. You can buy different fishing rods and add some tweaks to augment your playing style. It's mostly to give you some goals and rewards.

It's an okay game.  It's missing a few things, but what's there is fun to play with. If you're interested, I don't think you'll regret spending your five dollars.

14124399.review:
[i]Cat Goes Fishing[/i] is a casual, cat-induced, 2-D fishing ‘simulator.’ The goal here is to use an array of tools, including rods, boats, even bombs in conjunction with upgrades to complete a host of quests.

The casting mechanics are fairly straightforward, as there are only three buttons you’re likely to ever use. Click for casting/reeling & A/D for movement. There is no tutorial as of the writing of this review, but getting the general sense on how to start casting to maximum effect is quite simple. There isn’t any Menu either. 

While, the casting & movement mechanics couldn’t get any simpler, there is some depth on how you choose to complete the quests. There are many different types of effects you can apply to your rod to target or dissuade various types of fish or to augment other elements. There are also tools both temporary & permanent that will come in handy.

As you catch fish & complete quests, you will level & accrue currency. As you level, the quests get progressively more difficult. However, from my experience, there does appear to be a degree of randomness with respect to the quest system; old quests will pop up time & again. The quests will progressively get more & more grindy. Completing them will require you to farm currency for pro-longed periods of time, before you can purchase the necessary items & upgrades to complete them.

[i]Hats! Hats! & More Hats![/i] Yes, [i]Cat Goes Fishing[/i] does have an array of hats. They are obtained by catching them so keep an eye out. The sad part is that you can’t collect them. You can only wear one hat at a time. Each hat provides a useful boost. Be wary of accidentally selling a hat, as it is easy to do. 

There is an in-game catalog giving various details on the different types of fish, so it may yield some assistance in catching your desired fish.

The artwork is exactly as shown in the screenshots. The background scenery is under-utilized & quite bland. The sound is one uninspiring track looped continuously. Luckily, it can be muted with the ‘M’ key.

In conclusion, I wouldn’t label [i]Cat Goes Fishing[/i] as a fishing simulator. I wouldn’t recommend it to those who love fishing & desire that experience, albeit through the eyes of a cat. Rather, [i]Cat Goes Fishing[/i] is a game you pop in when you have a few minutes to kill, just for the posterity of seeing a cat catch some fish, while wearing a snazzy hat.

14108891.review:
It's a lovely game. If it doesn't fit on your screen, ALT+Enter makes it fit. 

The game has a fairly simple system when it comes to catching fish. Left click the mouse button and then let go at the desired height. You can upgrade your fishing rod itself, aswell as modify it so that it attracts/repels certain fish, casts faster, sinks deeper or slower aswell as many more things. You can also add attachments to the rod such as fireworks so that it can be cast farther or bombs to clear away large shoals of smaller fish. There is also direct rod upgrades which are graphically pleasing and overall, better rods.

You can either sell the fish you catch, or recast with them in order to use them as bait to catch the bigger, more expensive fishes and there's a plethora (25 ish at the moment) of different fishes to catch which all require different tactics. 

The money you gain you can use to purchase upgrades aswell as hats and boats for you to be able to fish better, deeper and further out. 

The quest and system rewards you with xp and money for catching x number of x fish. 

The games music is rather pleasing, although tiresome after long sessions.

This is actually quite good. Its basically a more laid back version of Insane Fishing. This is not a game you will play for hours at a time but it has a kind of peaceful zen feeling to it with more aspects unlocking as you go along. There are various types of rods with different stats like speed, strength and range. Each rod has upgrade slots to which you can add different things like sinkers or reel speed. In fact what upgrades you have equipped is part of the tactics. There are basic quests that give you a bit of direction, catch so many of a certain kind of fish etc for a cash bonus. This is not a game you will play for hours at a time or anything but its a good game for a 15 minute break or if you want to take a breather from something a bit more in depth. Give it a shot.
7 out of 10

14077443.review:
Much deeper then it appears. Amazingly fun game. 
Gameplay Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uNZaH8D5ln8
Starting as cat with a basic rod the controls are simple, you can play this with one hand. Fishing up the smaller species initially and selling them will reward you with money, which is used for purchase of better rods or upgrades to current equipment. The game then introduces you to it's quest system, completing these tasks rewards larger sums of money. While questing the fish catalog becomes useful as it will display all species in the game.

Sometimes fishing in the depths you may discover rare hats, which not only look cute on cat but give large bonuses to both your fishing abilities and values of catches. More tongue in cheek one-use items available later include rockets and bombs but everything has it uses. In these cases scaring away packs of fish or making your cast go much further with cheaper rods. Boat travel is also included, but I have not progressed that far yet.

Content wise, If you check the store page the developer mentions and I quote.
"Regular updates will bring new fish, boats, hats, and entirely new mechanics to the game, extending your experience and offering new ways to master the game. "

Addictive and enjoyable for all ages. Easily recommended. 

@developer
Only downside is the music, decent enough but maybe think about adding some more variety in future. :)

14075594.review:
I think many phone games should just stay on their tiny little screens, but there are some I've enjoyed on PC.  I really want to make some witty comment like Cat Goes Fishing has me hooked, but I really don't feel that strongly about it.  It's fun, in a casual, play a bit here and there way, which seems to be the phone game mantra.
     Cat Goes Fishing does take a bit of strategy, as you have to use smaller fish to catch larger ones, while trying to get the bait to the fish you want to catch.  This layered approach to baiting fish may seem tricky at first, but keep at it and in no time you'll be a master baiter.
